alert.note: Alert for Bienville; Bossier; Red River; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 11:01PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTH CENTRAL WEBSTER... NORTHEASTERN RED RIVER...SOUTHWESTERN BIENVILLE AND SOUTHEASTERN BOSSIER PARISHES THROUGH 1130 PM CDT... At 1100 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles southwest of Ringgold, or 22 miles southeast of Bossier City, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Coushatta, Ringgold, Heflin, Martin, Hall Summit, Castor, Edgefield, Jamestown, Lake Bistineau South, Plum Orchard Landing, Loggy Bayou, Womack, Crichton, Noles Landing, and Lake Bistineau North. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
